results.title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
results.description:
Notable is the leading intelligent automation company for healthcare. Customers use Notable to drive patient acquisition, retention, and reimbursement, scaling growth without hiring more staff. We don’t just make software. We are on a mission to fix the broken U.S. healthcare system by helping to eliminate the massive administrative burden that is placed on our nation’s healthcare staff. We hire people from diverse backgrounds and are always looking for employees who bring fresh ideas to our space. Passion is paramount, and at Notable, you will get to work with other talented people who aim to set the new standard for innovation in healthcare.

To support and accelerate our growth, we are hiring a product marketer to own positioning, growth strategy, messaging, and sales collateral development across our revenue cycle solutions. The ideal candidate for this role is a marketer who can wear many hats, with proven ability to learn quickly and adapt. We’re looking for somebody who can not only be a rockstar but who can bring the whole band together, driving cross-functional execution across marketing, product, and sales.

 

You will...

  • Refine and evolve Notable’s product positioning and messaging in the revenue cycle space.

  • Work with sales, marketing, and strategic partnerships organizations to develop GTM plans that include compelling messaging, value propositions, target buyer/influencer personas, etc. to ensure overall sales and partner success.

  • Use effective storytelling skills to develop (and maintain) our sales collateral bill-of-materials, including decks, demos, and one-pagers.

  • Drive competitive analysis and market research to inform future Notable product and engineering investment.

  • Plan and lead the launch of new products and releases - and work cross-functionally in the implementation of the plan.

  • Partner with content, customer, and growth marketing to define and execute pipeline generation programs.

  • Develop thought leadership pieces (whitepapers, webinars) to grow market credibility and support pipeline generation.

  • Provide subject matter expertise for content and growth marketing to drive effective campaigns across all stages of the sales funnel.

  • Partner with sales enablement to enable sellers to position and sell the Notable platform.

You are a great fit because you have...

  • 7+ years of PMM experience, ideally within healthcare revenue cycle and/or B2B technology

  • World-class writing skills across different mediums, from ad and web copy, to one-pagers and white papers.

  • Demonstrated experience developing high-impact sales messaging and slideware.

  • Healthcare domain expertise, or a strong desire to learn the ins and outs of the industry.

  • Basic familiarity with technical concepts (e.g. automation), or a strong desire to learn.

  • Proven ability to drive cross-functional collaboration with sales, product, and marketing stakeholders.

results.title: Performance Marketing Manager
results.description:
We're building the future of advertising and are looking for the minds to help us do it.

As a valuable member of Darkroom’s unique Performance Marketing team, you’ll be given the opportunity to specialize in data analysis, performance creative management, and/or media buying, depending on YOUR skills and preferences!

Essential to the growth of our clients' businesses, Darkroom Performance Marketing Managers are excellent communicators, proficient in advertising and marketing principles. The right candidate should be equally comfortable in a strategic position and an executional one when it comes to planning, building, and deploying paid media campaigns.

This is a remote job, and is open to candidates in the state(s) of California, Pennsylvania, New York, Florida, or Texas, and must have the right to work within the United States.

What you'll do:

  • Plan, develop, and implement comprehensive paid media strategies to increase brand visibility and recognition and drive new user acquisition and leads via paid media campaigns.

  • Conduct thorough brand and website audits to understand our clients’ key value proposition, core products, brand aesthetic and identify opportunities to successfully market them and make them stand out in the marketplace.

  • Conduct competitive research to ensure success in the ad space and new acquisition audience targeting.

  • Manage between 5-10 paid media accounts (including but not limited to: Facebook/Instagram Ads, Google/YouTube Ads, LinkedIn Ads, and other social platforms like Twitter and TikTok) on behalf of Darkroom clients, with aggregate monthly spends ranging between $25,000 - $1M.

  • Utilize Platform Ad Managers, third-party reporting tools, and Google Analytics to develop insights and action items intended to increase our clients’ revenues month-over-month and solve for attribution.

  • Understand important KPI and industry-wide benchmarks throughout all steps in the e-commerce marketing funnel.

  • Implement real-time and reactionary ad-buying decisions across multiple platforms in response to up-or-down trends happening on ads platforms.

  • Preemptively develop quarterly strategies for clientele based on perceived success metrics, ad spends, YoY performance metrics, and projections.

  • Deep dive into competitor research, industry knowns, and brand identity to manage client expectations and continually brainstorm new marketing initiatives, creative assets, copy, and review after results.

  • Understand digital marketing best practices and readily contribute to overarching marketing strategies to ensure client success across the board - even if it's paid media adjacent or outside of channel control.

  • Understand full-funnel marketing strategies to ensure new acquisition, list growth, e-commerce, website CRO, retention, and overall client success based around marketing discussions and strategies that work in tandem with paid media and performance efforts.

  • Understand client needs for success and preemptively deliver projections and forecasts that latter into client quarterly strategy

What you'll need to be successful:

  • 5+ years minimum of paid media advertising experience preferred (building high converting funnels and driving quantifiable results).

  • 5+ years minimum managing paid social and paid search advertising for growth clients, or clients spending $100k+ minimum monthly aggregate spend.

  • Expertise in developing, testing, and optimizing advertisement copy and creative

  • Experience in keyword targeting and audience optimization across multiple platforms

  • Background in creative consultation for successful Paid Social Ads that convert

  • Background in data-derived decision making and forecasting budgets/spend projections linked to perceived results

  • Experience using Google Analytics to develop insights and report them to stakeholders

What its like to work at Darkroom:

We're building the future of advertising and are looking for the minds to help us do it. We only seek out the best—from our clients to our people. Our team is our most sacred asset, and we offer highly competitive salaries and the following perks:

  • Darkweek, Unlimited Vacation Policy, and Holidays: Rebooting is one of the most important parts of growth. At Darkroom, you have access to a flexible vacation policy, our annual “Darkweek” summer break, and 10 holidays throughout the year to keep you recharged and sharp.

  • Location, location, (or no) location: Remote-first culture with a strong community base. With Hubs in LA, The Bay Area, New York, Philly, Lisbon, and Eastern Europe.

  • Health & wellness: Company-sponsored medical, dental, and vision benefits with, so you can stay as healthy as can be.

  • Finances, growth, and retirement: After one year with Darkroom, we deliver a robust 401k program with company match, equity incentives, and a profit-sharing opportunity so we can help you save as the company grows.

  • Endless opportunities for growth: Our agency is founded on an interdisciplinary approach, giving Darkroomers insights into services far beyond your job description. Grow your skills and interests beyond your niche and stay at the forefront of the industry through total immersion in cross-functional collaboration.

Our Hiring Process and Compensation:

The hiring process for this position typically follows four stages. We offer competitive salaries, and will be discussed further upon a phone interview.

Equal Opportunity Statement

Darkroom is an equal opportunity workplace—we are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national orientation, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

results.title: Mantle - Social Media Specialist
results.description:
Context

As proposed by one of BitDAO’s core contributors, Mantle is an Ethereum layer-2 network/chain with modular architecture designed to use $BIT as a native token. It's by combining rollups and modularity that Mantle powers new and diverse use cases (i.e. gaming, social, DeFi etc...) whilst remaining fast, secure and decentralized.

Mantle is a project co-developed by Windranger and Davion who are both product labs working on the BitDAO ecosystem. Over the next few years, BitDAO intends to continue securing large partnerships on the scale of zkSync, Game7, Mantle.

 

Your Role

  • Conceive social media and community strategies for different channels to build brand awareness, boost community engagement, and create and maintain Mantle, BitDAO and $BIT’s brand image.

  • Examine the existing marketing plan and social media strategy to analyze and determine strategic shortcomings; provide suggestions/proposals for revisions and modifications.

  • Build, monitor, grow and maintain vibrant online communities on Twitter, YouTube, Medium, etc. by planning and developing high-quality engaging content, activities, and campaigns.

  • Respond to comments and queries in a timely manner, identify and capture marketing opportunities as well as areas of improvement, and report on feedback and online reviews.

  • Interact meaningfully with the community and other relevant stakeholders (the wider Mantle community) as the project representative, daily via the official social media accounts.

  • Design creative social activities to drive community engagement and build an engaged community.

  • Work closely with the internal marketing and product teams to set up and implement social media and communication campaigns that tightly align with the overarching marketing and product strategies.

  • In collaboration with the design team, produce eye-catching, evoking visual content, including but not limited to campaign posters, banners, community call slides and presentation decks, gifs, videos, etc.

  • Serve as a host for weekly community calls and all other relevant events organized and held on Twitter Spaces, Discord, Youtube, etc.

  • Actively search for and arrange potential community-building opportunities, including but not limited to collaborations, features/mentioned in media outlets, speaking opportunities, and advertising opportunities.

  • Help scale and manage a team of community moderators and builders.

  • Manage a monthly social media and community budget and communicate with the relevant internal teams for budget allocation and distribution.

  • Analyze engagement data, identify trends in community interactions, research social media trends, and plan/update/propose suitable campaigns to build community online.

  • Track campaigns, measure their performance against the KPIs, collect feedback from the community, and produce regular reporting with the analysis on how to provide constant improvement of social and community ROI.

 

Your Craft

  • Extensive knowledge of web3 and protocol/layer-2 ecosystems

  • Strong interest and passion for blockchain

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and fluency in English

  • Experience with community building, managing, nurturing, and retaining layer-2 communities.

  • Experience in creating high quality visual content and paid media campaigns is a plus

  • Min 2 years experience in social media and community management

  • Outstanding copywriting skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a team

  • Highly motivated, detail-oriented, collaborative, and open-minded

results.title: Growth Marketing Specialist
results.description:
Are you a marketing wizard with a knack for growth hacking? Do you have a passion for paid marketing and a love for all things digital? If so, we may have the perfect role for you!

We're seeking a mid-level growth marketing guru to join our dynamic team at Wolf.xyz, a B2B SaaS startup that helps staffing companies launch their own talent marketplaces.

As our new growth marketing superhero, you'll be responsible for driving business growth through various digital marketing channels, including LinkedIn ads, Google Ads, SEO, and email marketing. You'll also have the opportunity to get creative and test out new marketing strategies to help us reach our growth goals.

But let's be real, this isn't your typical 9-to-5 job. You'll need to be a quick learner, have a strong work ethic, and be able to roll with the punches (because let's face it, startups can be unpredictable).

So if you're ready to take on a new challenge and join a team of passionate tech team, apply now! We can't wait to see what you've got in store for us.

Key Skills required:

  • Experience with paid marketing channels, such as LinkedIn ads, Google Ads, and social media advertising
  • Knowledge of SEO and how to optimize website content for search engines
  • Proficiency with email marketing platforms and techniques
  • Ability to analyze marketing data and use it to inform strategy and decision-making
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Creative problem-solving skills and the ability to think outside the box
  • Experience with A/B testing and other growth hacking techniques
  • Familiarity with project management tools and the ability to prioritize tasks effectively
  • Experience working with B2B SaaS or tech companies is a plus

What you'll be doing:

  • Develop and execute a growth marketing strategy to drive user acquisition and engagement
  • Plan and execute paid advertising campaigns on platforms such as Facebook and LinkedIn Ads
  • Develop and maintain email marketing campaigns to funnel leads and drive conversions
  • Analyze and report on the effectiveness of marketing campaigns, using tools such as Google Analytics
  • Collaborate with the product teams to optimize the user journey and conversion funnel
  • Stay up-to-date on industry trends and best practices in growth marketing

What we offer:

  • Ability to work remotely
  • Employee stock options and annual performance bonuses
  • Opportunity to learn exciting new skills and grow your career
  • This is a full-time role with US-based location preferred. Global OK

results.title: SEO Manager
results.description:
This is a 100% Remote Position based anywhere in the United States with work hours primarily in ET or CT zones.


Job Description

Come forge your own career path at an agency that prioritizes making lives better—including our employees, our families and our clients. At Kuno, we do “marketing that matters,” and we are seeking an ambitious, business-minded SEO expert who can help our company grow.

Your goal as the SEO Manager is to help guide the SEO team with a vision of organic growth, based on a consultative approach followed by implementation and reporting. You’ll be responsible for uncovering and accountable for the execution of the tactics that will move the needle for the client, and capture and nurture leads to grow their revenue—while generating more revenue for these services at Kuno.

You will act as the key stakeholder for SEO throughout the organization working cross-functionally to increase overall search rankings and traffic, manage the development of technical SEO implementations, and monitor changes in our page rankings. Additionally, in this role, you will be responsible for helping to grow this department by managing several SEO accounts and educating and assisting your SEO teammates.

Beyond just SEO, you will succeed in this role by combining great leadership experience with fantastic communication skills and a focus on strategic planning. We are hoping you will blow us away and grow quickly into a director role.

Since you will be contributing to the growth of the company, you will become an official employee-owner of the company on Day 1.

General Responsibilities

  • Coach the SEO team to help them provide premier SEO services to medium- and enterprise-sized clients
  • Provide SEO services to several medium- and enterprise-sized clients.
  • Serve as a client-facing consultant for SEO opportunities with future and existing clients, preparing assessments and other presentations
  • Provide basic training to the sales team and strategists to speak about our approach to organic growth
  • Research and analyze keyword strategies, performing ongoing keyword discovery, expansion, prioritization, and optimization using popular SEO tools, such as SEMrush, Surfer SEO, Screaming Frog, Google Analytics, and Google Search Console

Requirements

Skills & Experience

  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to clearly and confidently communicate strategy and recommendations
  • Able to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
  • This is a remote position and requires the ability to work from home using online meeting software such as Zoom, GoToMeeting or WebEx
  • Experience working with content management systems (CMS) such as WordPress or HubSpot is a plus but not required
  • Position is for Manager, but could be Director based on background of candidate

Education & Training

Kuno uses HubSpot sales and marketing software for most clients. Experience with HubSpot is helpful but not required. You will be given access to the HubSpot Academy online courses for ongoing training and education. During the first three months of employment, you will be asked to complete several video courses that provide certifications for a variety of topics that will help you have the most success in this position. Most courses are composed of a few hours of watching videos followed by a short exam of around 50 multiple-choice questions. The certifications need to be renewed annually.

Benefits

*Benefits for U.S. based employees only

  • Employee ownership (ESOP) with profit-sharing eligibility upon hire date
  • Unlimited paid vacation in addition to 10 paid national U.S. holidays
  • Healthcare (medical, dental, vision, short/long-term disability, life insurance)
  • Six weeks 100% paid maternity/family/medical leave
  • 401k with company match, fully vested

Compensation

  • Based on industry knowledge, geography (cost of living), and work experience in comparison to other candidates at the same job level

Mission

Kuno Creative’s mission is to help companies we believe in get results, and our success is fostered by our core values: Team Oriented... Proactive...Take Ownership. If you thrive in a collaborative, relationship-building environment, take initiative and use innovation to drive success, deliver quality work and take action to constantly improve, then we want you on our team!

Diversity & Inclusion

Kuno is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to creating a diverse environment. We are fully focused on promoting equality, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.

Geography

All employees are working 100% remotely. This position is open to anyone authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship who is residing in the United States.

About Kuno

Kuno is a leading digital marketing agency and Diamond HubSpot partner. We are employee-owned, continuously on the frontlines of buyer engagement. We do marketing that matters, helping companies make the world a better place. This mission penetrates our daily lives and well-being, and, ultimately, enables us to help clients achieve measurable results. All company profits are distributed to Kuno employees each year.

results.title: Marketing Manager
results.description:
About Medimap

We're transforming the way patients connect with healthcare providers by building a one-stop shop for easy access to care in their community. Founded in 2015, Medimap is the leading healthcare navigation platform in Canada and has been used by more than 12 Million Canadians. Following our recent funding we're rapidly expanding across geographies and markets and looking for talented individuals who have a passion for helping others.

About You

You are well versed at laying out strategies at the 10,000-foot view and then diving into the weeds and rolling up your sleeves to experiment and execute ideas. You'll optimize marketing campaigns across all channels to lead a campaign from conception to full execution. With a strong grasp of concepts on marketing tools, strategies, and integrated digital marketing campaigns, you will ensure that campaigns launch on time and within budget.

With the ultimate goal of growing our brand's loyalty and awareness across Canada, you will also get to build marketing best practices and protocols, laying the foundation for years to come.

A typical week in the life of the Marketing Manager looks like

  • Planning and executing all web, SEO/SEM, marketing database, email, social media, and display advertising campaigns
  • Designing, implementing, and maintaining a strong social media presence
  • Measuring and reporting on digital marketing campaign performances, and assessing these against ROI and KPIs
  • Optimizing total spend and performance based on trend insights
  • Brainstorming new and creative growth strategies
  • Planning and executing experiments and conversion tests
  • Creating our landing pages and optimizing user experience by collaborating with internal teams
  • Evaluating end-to-end customer experience using an analytical ability by looking across multiple channels
  • Constantly providing thought leadership, support, and on-going partnership
  • Managing and staying on top of marketing expenses and budget

What you have:

  • A Bachelor's degree or similar education in marketing or equivalent experience in a relevant field
  • A minimum of 5 years' experience in a digital marketing position
  • Knowledge of key marketing channels: email, advertising, SEO, website and blog management, ppc and others.
  • In-depth knowledge of various social media platforms, best practices, and website analytics.
  • Highly creative with excellent analytical abilities
  • Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
  • Up-to-date on the latest trends and technologies in digital marketing.
  • The ability to work independently in a remote environment

 

This is a 12 month contract position that can lead to full-time.

results.title: Marketing Operations and Insights Senior Manager
results.description:
Sonatype is the software supply chain management company. We're on a mission to change how the world innovates by making software development easier. From running the world's largest repository of Java open source components (Maven Central) to inventing componentized software development, and then software supply chain management, to creating the only solution that stops malicious open-source malware in its tracks, we're constantly leading the industry while helping thousands of customers manage open source every day.

Already used by 15 million developers, we have lofty goals for our technology to be in the hands of every engineering team. And, we need you to do that. Join us!

Learn more at www.sonatype.com.


The Marketing Operations and Insights Senior Manager role will help us in our mission by reporting, analyzing and managing the performance of critical initiatives that help grow and scale our business. Your role will be dynamic and fast-paced and will require working collaboratively across the marketing function to oversee high-impact program deployment through comprehensive performance reporting. This person will be instrumental in the future of the function and provide insights to stakeholders to prove value, shape future campaigns and inform overall marketing strategy.
If you are adept at hard analytical and soft people skills, and able to adapt to rapidly changing business needs, then this job can provide a great deal of personal satisfaction. Strengths in business process assessment, project management, measurement and re-engineering are key, as is the ability to leverage technology to implement business solutions. This is a "roll up your sleeves" organizational role; the successful candidate is expected to perform all functions from administrative processing to supporting and leading strategic change initiatives within marketing.


What You Will Do:
  • Work cross-functionally with the marketing team, finance and sales operations to support marketers with strategy, project coordination, budget tracking, execution, and regular performance review for key, multi-channel, marketing initiatives.
  • Manage alignment to finance for efficient budget management and ROMI analysis.
  • Understand and deliver reporting to advise pipeline forecasting (and related company performance) and annual planning initiatives.
  • Lead tracking the efficacy of marketing initiatives and help implement the appropriate reporting and metrics to ensure desired results are being achieved and communicated to leadership.
  • Proactive identification of issues that could impact the successful growth thesis of the marketing function.


Who You Are:
  • Bachelor’s degree; MBA preferred.
  • 3+ years’ consulting, analytical, and/or marketing operations experience.
  • Solid project management skills, having managed and successfully delivered multiple, sophisticated cross-functional projects on-time and on-budget.
  • Strong analytical and quantitative skills.
  • Proven track record of project delivery, interacting with all levels of management.
  • Coordinate interactions amongst and support to the marketing (and GTM) leadership team as needed (e.g. be lead on setting agendas for offsites, coordinating board meeting preparations).


What We Are Proud Of:
  • Fast Company Top 50 Companies for Innovators 2018, 2019, and 2020
  • 2019 Best Places to Work Washington Post and Washingtonian
  • 2019 Wealthfront Top Career Launch Company
  • EY Entrepreneur of the Year 2019
  • Diversity & Inclusion Working Groups
  • Parental Leave Policy
  • Paid Volunteer Time Off (VTO)

results.title: Marketing & Communications Intern
results.description:
We’re looking for a creative, hands-on Marketing Intern to support our Brand and Communications team.

Are you 24/7 scrolling through social media? Are you known for always being up to date on the latest trends and influencers? Are you already thinking that this job ad would have worked better as a video?
Smiler is a brand that is driven by the need to create – we’re capturing hundreds of photos every hour, for thousands of people around the world, all in an effort to preserve the moments that matter most.
That’s why we’re looking for a young gun that is driven by the same obsessive need to ideate, create and generate. Whether it’s words, videos or visuals, this is more than just making sure the pixels are perfect or the grammar is great. If your brain is like a firehose of ideas, you’re passionate about travel and/or photography, and you’re still reading this after that firehose brain metaphor, we would love to hear from you.
This role will have the opportunity to shape, build and execute global communication campaigns as part of the team that develops, coordinates and executes Smiler’s marketing and communications worldwide.

 

What will you do:

  • Work as part of our Brand team to develop content concepts and strategies for customer and photographer audiences

  • Come up with creative still and video concepts for Instagram, TikTok, Linkedin and Facebook

  • Act as guardian and protector of our social media accounts and engage with our audience

  • Respond to queries via our social media channels

  • Research, identify and approach key influencers who are in line with our brand identity

  • Help establish brand partnerships

  • Find new creative opportunities to grow our channels even more

  • Plan, write and source imagery for daily content

  • Roll up your sleeves and get hands-on with various other types of content, such as articles, infographics, case studies, newsletters and other marketing materials

  • Support the team with other content and marketing tasks, such as brand and marketing, community management, Online Travel Agencies and more

Requirements:

  • Enrolled final year student in Communications, Marketing or similar relevant education

  • Experience with design software including Canva and/or Adobe

  • Excellent written and grammatical skills in English. Knowledge of other European languages would be muy bueno / wünderbar / lekker

  • Strategic, creative and conceptual mindset

  • A genuine hunger for development, keen to chase after opportunities when you identify a chance to make an impact and get involved

  • A creative and analytical mind that knows how to make things happen and seize content opportunities when they come your way

  • Good communication skills, a flair for storytelling, and knowledge of how to target specific audiences

 

What we’re offering

  • An empowered role with real responsibilities

  • A platform to showcase your strategic thinking and creative output

  • The opportunity to play a part in shaping our content and audience engagement strategy

  • A flexible working environment as a work-from-anywhere company

  • A warm company culture - we are inclusive, social, and happy to help you grow

  • An excellent learning environment - you will get first-hand experience of the role and we’ll guide you through your journey

  • A potential full-time role depending on your performance after your internship

 

Does this sound like the challenge you’re looking for?

Apply by clicking the apply button, fill in the online form, attach your CV and make a short (selfie) video to explain why you are the best hire for this role. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at careers@joinsmiler.com.

 

Here’s what happens after you send your application:

You’ll receive an email confirmation confirming our hiring department has received your application. And an update will follow as to what the next stage of this adventure will be for you

More information on our website www.joinsmiler.com

 

About Smiler:

We believe that valuable memories deserve to be captured in high quality. It’s our mission to achieve that on a global scale for everyone. We are the world’s first on-the-spot photography marketplace that brings photographers and consumers together at tourist hotspots and other leisure locations. Globally, we are one of the most ambitious and fastest-growing startups to achieve international scale at lightning speed. We are already live on 3 continents, 70 countries, and over 670 cities, and we need your help to expand further!

results.title: Marketing Technology Manager
results.description:
Description



About Teamwork:

Teamwork's mission is to make teams who deliver client work become efficient, organized, profitable and happy! Our platform has revolutionized how companies manage their daily workflows for improved automation, productivity, and profitability. It acts as the ‘one-stop-shop’ practice management solution enabling our customers to track, manage, and invoice their projects. Our relentless customer-focus has been rewarded with thousands of amazing customers all across the globe and millions of users who sign in every day. We pride ourselves on creating market leading software, working with outstanding people, and going above and beyond for our customers. Trusted by more than 20,000 teams across 170 countries, Teamwork is in acceleration mode as we set our sights to become the undisputed Project Management platform for teams who deliver client work.

We believe in hiring great people and look to ensure everyone has the best possible experience of work, everyday. We strive to be open and transparent, humble and customer focused. And we thrive on curiosity, getting results and working together relentlessly to deliver excellence. We are a company of action, full of triers and doers: we try things, we make mistakes, and we learn from them. Our personality is unmistakable: we work hard, take joy in our wins and each other's successes and important life events. And we care and support each other when life throws lemons. More than anything we embrace a straightforward approach to getting things done. We are fanatical about our customers: and when talent meets passion, success happens.

 



The opportunity:

We are looking for an experienced Marketing Technology Manager to join our growing Marketing Team. As the Marketing Technology Manager, you will be responsible for the flawless administration of our marketing technology stack. You will act as the team’s marketing technology and automation expert, ensuring the optimal selection, configuration and adoption of fit-for-purpose marketing technologies to meet the various marketing teams’ needs. You will  also collaborate across the entire team to improve operational and campaign effectiveness. This is a hands-on role that allows you to pivot between delivery and marketing technology management and governance.  This role will collaborate with internal stakeholder as well as vendors. 

 

Some of the key responsibilities of the role are: 

 

  • Own the marketing tech stack, making recommendations for improvements and optimizations
  • Own the administration of our marketing technology stack (Hubspot, Storyblok, GA4 & Optimize, Intercom, Hotjar, and more), including assets, governance and serve as the main support contact
  • Audit our current marketing automation set up and make recommendations for improvement
  • Drive adoption of our marketing tech stack across the marketing team ensuring best practices for adoption and usage
  • Implement and maintain marketing attribution tracking, lead scoring, and lead routing in partnership with Marketing stakeholders
  • Own operational projects such as database cleanups, email template revamps, and workflows 
  • Create database queries to build lists and segments
  • Partner with the Lifecycle marketing team to optimize our email programs
  • Partner with our internal IT team to ensure the marketing automation tool and tech stack are integrated correctly with other internal systems
  • Partner with Marketing Analytics to build and maintain global reports and dashboards and support revenue attribution 
  • Partner with the Rev Ops team, marketing stakeholders, and other teams to evaluate, select and implement new marketing technologies 
  • Manage own backlog for agile delivery aligning with the goals driven by marketing team
  • Ensure all assets are GDPR complaint

 



What good looks like:

  • Solid experience in a marketing technology or marketing operations role
  • Prior experience implementing and updating lead scoring within a marketing automation system
  • Deep experience with Hubspot, or other similar systems
  • Experience with marketing tools such as GA4 & Google Optimize, ZoomInfo, Storyblok, Intercom, Hotjar and more
  • Strong understanding of emerging marketing technologies as they pertain to B2B SaaS subscription businesses
  • Familiarity with SaaS marketing concepts, terminology, and approaches is a big plus
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills with ability to present complex information in understandable way to all levels of the organisation
  • Be able to quickly establish rapport, credibility, trust, and respect throughout the organisation at all levels
  • Skilled project manager, with ability to able to successfully manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, ambiguous start-up environment while working independently with little direction or direct supervision
  • Proven ability to collaborate across marketing, sales, product and other functional teams to drive towards a common goal

 



What you can expect:

We are a remote-friendly team, with the option to work out of our Cork HQ campus, Belfast or Boston hubs - or fully remotely. At Teamwork we believe that work is what you do, not where you sit.

You will experience a collaborative and flat culture, where titles are less valued than delivering outcomes that impact and move the dial. We want you to have what you need to hit the ground running, so you will get the best kit to help you do your best work from Day 1. Our onboarding program will give you the opportunity to meet Teamworkers, learn about our market leading product and get under the hood of our Grow and Scale strategy.  

We expect our people to work hard, level up and turn up every day focused on being their best for each other and our customers. In return, you can expect to know what success looks like in your role, and have regular check-ins with your manager. In addition we will work with you to grow your career with Teamwork.

But when all is said and done we want you to have fun and enjoy working with us! We put a lot of effort into having regular social events, a weekly all staff catch up with quizzes and prizes to be won, and an annual staff gathering Grand Council focused on celebrating the wins, planning for success and building connection & collaboration. Strengths that have made us what we are today! But take some time and read more about our story and our values here

We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you



Core Benefits and Perks:

  • Employee Share Options (ESOP)- we mean what we say when we say, ‘act like an owner’!
  • Competitive salary & OTE
  • 30 days vacation
  • Pension - matching 5% PRSA
  • Health plans and wellbeing programs
  • Give Back program
  • Ministry of Happiness social club
  • Educational resources and generous allowance to support development
  • Inclusive policies - maternity, paternity & parent leave, as well as a focus on flexible working
  • Recognition programs

 

Teamwork is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, family status, disability, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality or ethnic origin

results.title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
results.description:
About us

Qualio is on a mission to empower life science teams to launch and scale life-saving products. We’re doing that by building a connected and integrated quality management platform for the entire life science ecosystem. Qualio is trusted by 100s of highly regulated international customers, ranging from the bleeding edge of computational biology and machine learning to household names in mRNA vaccine development. 

The Qualio team is an all-remote, globally distributed workforce with teammates in over ten countries.

What’s the opportunity? 

Make a significant impact in a company helping improve lives by enabling teams to launch and scale quality health sciences products. The mission of product marketing is to learn from customers, the market, partners, the sales team, customer success teams, and the rest of Qualio and then build out and refine the positioning, messaging and content that educates partners, prospects and customers on how Qualio meets their needs. You will work closely with the sales, customer success, product and partners to understand what content helps drive acceleration along the customer journey. 

Join Qualio and help companies discover a better way to manage the quality of their products.

What will I be doing? 
  • Craft and own the communication around the business value proposition, working with internal and external stakeholders as well as technical and non-technical audiences
  • Develop and coordinate marketing strategies
  • Strong collaboration with Product, Sales, Customer Success and other Marketing teams
  • Publicly launch new products and features to our partners and channels delivering messaging that communicates the product’s value 
  • Develop partner and market-facing assets including collateral, data sheets, white papers, videos, presentations and selling tools across a wide range of quality and regulatory topics
  • Work closely with demand generation to create amazing prospects experiences and customer journeys
  • Bring customer stories to life through content that will resonate with our target audience
  • Speak or present at industry events or webinars when needed
  • Monitors markets for emerging trends to identify opportunities/challenges
  • Support sales by driving competitive intelligence
  • Build an engaged community/following to establish Qualio as a thought leader and influencer in quality management for life sciences
What skills do I need? 
  • Strong product marketing experience in a B2B software environment
  • Strong ability to influence and work cross-functionally 
  • Excellent writer and storyteller - ability to articulate, in written and spoken forms internally and externally, the long-term vision and also help sales and marketing communicate value of Qualio
  • Product and market expertise - Prior experience in a related field is a bonus, but you’ll need to demonstrate the ability to learn and grow
  • Ability to manage complex, cross-functional projects
  • Strong analytical aptitude to analyze customer data in order to find commonalities, trends, and stories that can be used in marketing and to make strategy decisions
  • Able to perform under pressure, prioritize and deliver results in a demanding and fast-paced environment that requires fresh thinking and innovation
  • A demonstrated history of being a team player, and desire to jump in and get your hands dirty as needed.
Benefits 

In addition to playing an important role in building Qualio, you'll receive:

  • Competitive salary
  • Matching 401k
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits
  • Unlimited PTO (minimum of 15 days/year)
  • Professional development budget
  • Co-working space allowance or home office budget
  • Company retreats 
  • 12-weeks fully paid parental leave
  • Opportunity to make a difference through helping life-saving products to get to market
A note to candidates:

Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every single one of the qualifications as described in a job description. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive company and we are most interested in finding the BEST candidate for the job. That candidate may be one who comes from a less traditional background, and that’s okay. We would strongly encourage you to apply, even if you don't believe you meet every one of the qualifications described.
